meanings.definition: Favoring or implementing social reform or new, liberal ideas
meanings.sent1: The ultraliberal politician proposed a plan for free healthcare for all.
meanings.sent2: She is known for her ultraliberal views on environmental protection.
meanings.sent3: The ultraliberal group organized a rally for equal rights with colorful banners.
meanings.sent4: His ultraliberal approach to education shook up the traditional system.
meanings.sent5: The ultraliberal vision of a fair society inspired many to join the cause.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a willingness to advocate for change and progress
meanings.sent1: The ultraliberal student council member proposed a recycling program for the school.
meanings.sent2: Her ultraliberal attitude towards innovation led to groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The ultraliberal team brainstormed creative solutions to improve the community.
meanings.sent4: His ultraliberal spirit of cooperation brought diverse groups together.
meanings.sent5: The ultraliberal approach to problem-solving sparked positive transformations.

meanings.definition: Holding extreme liberal views or beliefs
meanings.sent1: The ultraliberal activist demanded immediate action on climate change.
meanings.sent2: Their ultraliberal stance on social justice made waves in the media.
meanings.sent3: The ultraliberal party threw a themed party celebrating progressive values.
meanings.sent4: Her ultraliberal opinions on equality challenged societal norms.
meanings.sent5: The ultraliberal perspective on inclusivity resonated with many supporters.
